alert.note: Alert for Northwest Deserts; Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 1:56PM MST until February 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 4000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches in the higher elevations of the Arizona Strip and the Hualapai Mountains, with 1 to 4 inches as low as Kingman. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northwest Plateau and Northwest Deserts. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 AM Thursday to 5 AM MST Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult today, and very difficult to impossible in the higher elevations Thursday and Thursday night.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous or impossible. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
